head.title: National Briefing | Washington: Senate Confirms Woman As Head Of D.E.A.

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Washington: Senate Confirms Woman As Head Of D.E.A.

abstract.p: Senate confirms Karen Tandy as first woman to lead Drug Enforcement Administation; she succeeds Asa Hutchinson; photo (S)

block.p: The Senate has confirmed a longtime Justice Department official to become the first woman to lead the Drug Enforcement Administration. The official, Karen Tandy, a former federal prosecutor who currently heads the Justice Department task force on drug trafficking, was confirmed by the Senate without dissent late Thursday night. Senator Orrin G. Hatch, the Utah Republican who is chairman of the Judiciary Committee, praised Ms. Tandy for ''a long and impressive 25-year career with the Department of Justice.'' She succeeds Asa Hutchinson, who left the D.E.A. this year to become undersecretary of homeland security.
